alert.note: Alert for Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Northwest Deserts; Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 12:41PM MST until August 17 at 6:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .A substantial moisture surge driven by Hurricane Hilary will result in several days of moderately heavy rainfall over the weekend into early next week. Impacts will become more significant with each passing day as soils saturate, resulting in increased runoff. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Friday, rain will be monsoon-driven and pulsey. Saturday through Monday, rain will be tropical and consistent. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following areas, Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave, Lake Mead National Recreation Area, Northwest Deserts and Northwest Plateau. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Northwest Deserts; Northwest Plateau
